IMPORTANT!!! We are NOT a crisis center! If you or a friend is in immediate danger, please call the Suicide Prevention Lifeline at 1-800-273-TALK(8255) to speak with a trained professional. Do not call or send us a message.

The A Million Voices Campaign For High Schools and Universities

JOIN US!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

The American Association of Suicidology (AAS) began the A Million Voices Campaign as a way to raise awareness about suicide and to generate financial support for survivor services. Now, AAS is looking to expand the Campaign into America’s universities and high schools.

The A Million Voices (AMV) Campaign has been piloted around the country, with volunteers circulating AMV cards in a half dozen states. The cards contain suicide facts and warning signs as well as information about where to seek help. Campaign volunteers ask for $1 for suicide prevention, then give the donor a card. AAS has pledged to use 85 percent of the contributions to fund suicide prevention efforts, such as new support groups and materials for survivors.

Proceeds of the High School and University project will go toward supporting the suicide prevention efforts of the schools. Young people may not have hundreds to give, but $1 at a time, everyone can contribute toward saving lives from suicide.

To start a campaign in your city, university, or high school, please contact us at amv@suicidology.org

Check us out at www.suicidology.org

1. Suicide is preventable!
